subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to log JUnits Tests
msgSnippet: Hi Jan, ... Ok. I made the assumption based on orders getting numbers from a seemingly random source, which to me implied an integration test connecting to a
messageBody:
Hi Jan,


On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
> > Am I correct in assuming that these are integration/system tests
> > that you just happen to be writing on top of JUnit?
>
> No, I'm not.

Ok. I made the assumption based on orders getting "numbers" from a
seemingly random source, which to me implied an integration test
connecting to a database. My bad.


On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> > > Somethimes I find it usefull to have a log of what my tests have
> > > been doing when they succeed.
>
> > Interesting. So you don't trust your test?
>
> I trust my tests. But I like to show other people what my tests did.

Even more interesting. Just for bragging? ;)


On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> > I presume you're not doing test-driven development?
>
> Because I write some info to a log file?

No. Because I interpreted your earlier statement as you not trusting
your tests. Writing the test first and seeing it fail for the reason
you expect kind of assures you your test is doing what you expect it
to do. That's all.


-Lasse-
